change.item: This finding aid was updated in alignment with LC EAD 2.0 specifications using a python script created by Erik Radio.

did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: Original holographic manuscript, unbound and incomplete, and missing the first half of the story. The manuscript starts with chapter 20, which corresponds to chapter 21 in the published book. Written in both pen and pencil, it contains her edits. Some duplicate typescript chapters are also present. The novel is about a young woman's love for a soldier, set in England during World War I.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

accessrestrict.p: There are no restrictions on this collection.

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: Robin (MS 029). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized by chapter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Original holographic manuscript, unbound and incomplete, and missing the first half of the story. The manuscript starts with chapter 20, which corresponds to chapter 21 in the published book. Written in both pen and pencil, it contains her edits. Some duplicate typescript chapters are also present. The novel is about a young woman's love for a soldier, set in England during World War I.

relatedmaterial.p: Published in 1922 by William Heinemann, London; also A.L. Burt Co. and Frederick A. Stokes Co., both of New York.
Sequel to The Head of the House of Coombe: see MS 28 for that manuscript.

controlaccess.subject: World War, 1914-1918 -- England -- Fiction.
controlaccess.persname: Burnett, Frances Hodgson, 1849-1924. Head of the house of Coombe.
